item.title: 特朗普关税考验印度央行：决策指南
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对印度的关税冲击使印度央行周三的利率决定复杂化，一些经济学家提前了对宽松政策的预期。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s tariff shock on India is complicating the central bank’s interest rate decision Wednesday, with some economists bringing forward their expectations for easing.】

item.title: 香港亿万富翁的开发商大鸿辉获得私人贷款
item.description: 香港开发商大鸿辉企业有限公司（Tai Hung Fai Enterprise Co.【原文：Hong Kong developer Tai Hung Fai Enterprise Co., founded by billionaire Edwin Leong, has secured a private loan of up to HK$900 million ($115 million), people familiar with the matter said, as more property firms turn to such financing.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁加征关税，印度股市迎来波动
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 民间调查显示中国服务业活动意外回升
item.description: 一项民间调查显示，7 月份中国服务业活动意外回升，与官方调查显示的暑期旅游旺季复苏形成鲜明对比。【原文：China’s services activity unexpectedly picked up in July, a private survey showed, contrasting with an official poll to indicate resilience amid the summer travel season.】

item.title: 服务业下滑，澳大利亚家庭支出低于预期
item.description: 由于消费者缩减了服务支出，澳大利亚 6 月份的家庭支出低于预期。【原文：Australia’s household spending came in weaker than expected in June as consumers scaled back outlays on services.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚警方拘留伪造数据的前渔业公司首席执行官和其他两人
item.description: 印度尼西亚警方拘留了 eFishery 公司的联合创始人和前首席执行官，他曾承认在这家曾经风光无限的水产养殖初创企业中伪造了财务信息。【原文：Indonesian police have detained the co-founder and former chief executive officer of eFishery, who has previously admitted faking financial information at the once high-flying aquaculture startup.】

item.title: 官员称美国正在为人工智能芯片开发更好的定位追踪器
item.description: 一位高级官员说，美国正在探索如何为芯片配备更好的定位追踪功能，这凸显了华盛顿为遏制英伟达（Nvidia）等公司生产的半导体流向中国所做的努力。【原文：The US is exploring ways to equip chips with better location-tracking capabilities, a senior official said, underscoring Washington’s effort to curtail the flow of semiconductors made by the likes of Nvidia Corp. to China.】

item.title: 日本赤泽将访问美国，就汽车关税削减时机施压
item.description: 日本最高贸易谈判代表计划于周二启程前往美国，因为东京希望敦促华盛顿按照上月贸易协议中的承诺削减汽车关税。【原文：Japan’s top trade negotiator plans to leave for the US on Tuesday as Tokyo aims to urge Washington to proceed with a cut to tariffs on cars as promised in last month’s trade deal.】

item.title: Nyrstar 公司获得 8700 万美元以维持澳大利亚冶炼厂的运营
item.description: Nyrstar NV 公司表示，它将从澳大利亚政府获得 1.35 亿澳元（8,700 万美元）的资金，以防止皮里港铅冶炼厂和霍巴特锌厂的关闭，同时它还在研究潜在的扩张计划，目的是在中国之外建立关键的矿产供应链。【原文：Nyrstar NV said it will receive A$135 million ($87 million) from Australian governments to prevent the closure of the Port Pirie lead smelter and Hobart zinc works, while it studies a potential expansion aimed at building critical minerals supply chains outside China.】

item.title: 菲律宾 7 月通胀率降至 0.9%，创近六年新低
item.description: 菲律宾的通胀率在 7 月份降至近六年来的最低点，并保持在央行的目标值以下，这为货币当局在今年进一步降息提供了空间。【原文：Philippine inflation decelerated to the lowest in nearly six years in July and stayed below the central bank’s target, giving monetary authorities room to cut interest rates further this year.】

item.title: 美国数据疲软支撑美联储降息预期，黄金保持涨势
item.description: 在交易员对美国联邦储备委员会将在 9 月份举行的下一次会议上降息越来越乐观之后，黄金保持了小幅上涨。【原文：Gold held a small gain after traders became increasingly optimistic that the US Federal Reserve will cut rates at its next meeting in September.】

item.title: 日本小组敦促上调最低工资，为日本央行带来光明信号
item.description: 一个为日本政府提供建议的小组呼吁连续第二年创纪录地提高最低工资标准，这向日本央行发出了一个积极的信号，因为日本央行正在追求以需求为导向的经济增长。【原文：A panel advising Japan’s government called for a record increase to the minimum wage for a second straight year, sending a positive signal to the Bank of Japan as it pursues demand-led economic growth.】

item.title: 被八月熔断烧伤的交易员继续押注日本股市
item.description: 日元史诗般的反弹颠覆了货币交易，并导致从东京到纽约的股市暴跌，一年之后，日本股市已重新站稳脚跟。【原文：A year after an epic rebound in the yen upended currency trading and sent shares tumbling from Tokyo to New York, Japan’s stock market has found firmer footing.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁印度接受俄罗斯原油，石油止跌回升
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁要惩罚购买莫斯科原油的印度，投资者权衡了俄罗斯供应的风险，石油在连续三天下跌后企稳。【原文：Oil steadied after a three-day drop as investors weighed risks to Russian supplies, with US President Donald Trump stepping up his threat to penalize India for buying Moscow’s crude.】

item.title: 澳大利亚选择日本护卫舰计划，加强战略关系
item.description: 澳大利亚国防部长理查德-马尔斯（Richard Marles）表示，澳大利亚已选择日本三菱重工建造新型护卫舰，这将促进两国之间的战略关系。【原文：Australia has selected Japan’s Mitsubishi Heavy Industries to build a new class of naval frigate, Defense Minister Richard Marles said, boosting strategic ties between the nations.】

item.title: 韩国通胀降温，促使韩国央行再次降息
item.description: 韩国消费者通胀速度放缓，这为央行恢复降息周期提供了更多动力，因为这个依赖贸易的经济体正在为美国提高关税的影响做准备。【原文：The pace of consumer inflation in South Korea slowed, giving the central bank added incentive to resume its rate-cut cycle as the trade-reliant economy braces for the impact from higher US tariffs.】

item.title: 特朗普政府发布关税实施指南
item.description: 根据美国海关和边境保护局发布的指南，唐纳德-特朗普总统扩大互惠关税将不适用于纽约时间周四上午12:01之前装船运入美国的任何产品。【原文：President Donald Trump’s expanded reciprocal tariffs will not apply to any products loaded onto a vessel for transport into the United States before 12:01 a.m. New York time on Thursday, according to guidance issued by US Customs and Border Protection.】

item.title: 亚洲股市有望追随华尔街涨势：市场综述
item.description: 在新一波逢低买盘推动标普 500 指数创下 5 月以来最大涨幅之后，亚洲股市大多将追随华尔街走高。【原文：Asian stocks were mostly set to follow Wall Street higher after a fresh wave of dip buying drove the S&P 500’s biggest rally since May.】

item.title: CFTC 探讨让期货交易所交易现货加密货币
item.description: 美国商品期货交易委员会正在研究如何让一些注册期货交易所上市以太币和比特币等杠杆数字资产。【原文：The Commodity Futures Trading Commission is looking at how to let some registered futures exchanges list leveraged digital assets like Ether and Bitcoin.】

item.title: 页岩油首席执行官称石油市场将迎来原油供应熊市
item.description: 二叠纪盆地最大的独立石油钻探商警告说，未来几个月将有大量原油供应涌入全球市场，情况不容乐观。【原文：The largest independent Permian Basin oil driller is warning of a bearish influx of crude supplies to global markets in coming months.】

item.title: 瑞银称企业信贷市场正闪现自满迹象
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS）称，从一个关键指标来看，随着债务估值接近数十年来的高点，美国企业信贷市场比股市表现出更大的自满迹象。【原文：Corporate credit markets in the US are exhibiting greater signs of complacency than the stock market by one key measure, as debt valuations approach multidecade highs, according to UBS.】

item.title: 关税是如何运作的？谁支付，谁征收
item.description: 随着美国关税的激增开始重新定义美国的贸易关系，美国消费者正在接受一堂关于进口税如何运作的速成课程。以下是基本知识。【原文：As radical increases in US tariffs begin to redefine the country’s trading relationships, American consumers are getting a crash course in how taxes on imports work. Here are the basics.】

item.title: 尽管巴西销售额激增，但 MercadoLibre 仍未实现盈利
item.description: MercadoLibre Inc. 的股价下跌，原因是这家电子商务巨头的净收入未能达到分析师的预期，这盖过了该公司在巴西扩大免费送货政策带来的收入增长。【原文：MercadoLibre Inc.’s shares fell after the e-commerce giant missed analysts’ estimates for net income, overshadowing a jump in revenue from the expansion of the company’s free shipping policies in Brazil.】

item.title: 克莱尔餐厅拖欠租金，濒临破产申请
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，Claire's Stores Inc. 离申请破产保护的日子越来越近了，因为这家青少年饰品连锁店决定不支付 6 月和 7 月部分店铺的租金。【原文：Claire’s Stores Inc. is inching closer to filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy as the teen accessory chain elected to miss June and July rent payments on some stores, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Palantir 公布销售额增长 48%，称人工智能影响 "惊人
item.description: Palantir Technologies 公司报告称，第二季度收入增长了 48%，超过 10 亿美元，理由是人工技术对其业务产生了 "惊人的影响"。【原文：Palantir Technologies Inc. reported a 48% increase in revenue for the second quarter to more than $1 billion, citing the “astonishing impact” of artificial technology on its business.】

item.title: CuspAI 正洽谈融资 1 亿美元以探索新材料
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，英国初创公司 CuspAI 正在洽谈筹集超过 1 亿美元的资金，以支持其利用人工智能模型发现新材料的目标。【原文：British startup CuspAI is in talks to raise more than $100 million in funding to support its goal of using artificial intelligence models to discover new materials, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 新山公司考虑为 Azuria Water 成立 10 亿美元的二级基金
item.description: 新山资本公司（New Mountain Capital）正在考虑为其投资的 Azuria Water Solutions 公司进入二级市场，这是最近一家私募股权公司在艰难的交易环境中试图延长对一家投资组合公司的控制权。【原文：New Mountain Capital is considering tapping the secondary market for its Azuria Water Solutions, the latest private equity firm trying to extend its hold on a portfolio company in a tough dealmaking environment.】
